theoryTitle: Knock-Up Stream as Escape from Ancient Flood
theoryText: The Knock-Up Stream phenomenon may have been used by ancient civilizations as a method to escape a great flood. The fact that Jaya's golden city was launched into the sky by a Knock-Up Stream suggests this natural phenomenon could have been integral to the Ancient Kingdom's history. Some theorize that similar streams might exist around the world and could become crucial during a future world-flooding event.

popularity.supportingEvidence: The historical precedent of Shandora being launched to the sky, foreshadowing about world flooding in later arcs
popularity.counterEvidence: No direct confirmation of intentional use by ancients

sources.title: One Piece: 5 Key Ways Oda Foreshadowed The Sinking Of The World
One Small Detail in the Skypiea Arc May Solely be Responsible for Causing the World of One Piece to be Devastatingly Flooded

theoryTitle: Skypiea as Microcosm of the Entire One Piece Story
theoryText: The Skypiea Arc, beginning with Episode 152's journey, is theorized to be a condensed version of the entire One Piece story. The journey via the Knock-Up Stream represents the dangerous path to reaching the ultimate goal. The conflict between the Shandians and Skypieans mirrors the Ancient Kingdom vs World Government conflict. The golden city of Shandora parallels Laugh Tale. This theory suggests Oda used Skypiea to foreshadow major endgame reveals.

popularity.supportingEvidence: Parallel structures, similar themes, Roger's connection to Skypiea shown later

sources.title: Skypiea is a condensed version of One Piece
[ONE PIECE] Skypiea - The Most Important Arc in the History of One Piece

theoryTitle: Laugh Tale Split by Knock-Up Stream
theoryText: Similar to how Jaya was split by the Knock-Up Stream with half remaining below and half going to the sky, some theorize that Laugh Tale (or another crucial island) experienced the same fate. This could explain why Laugh Tale is so difficult to find - part of it might be in the sky while another part remains in the Blue Sea. The Straw Hats' journey via the Knock-Up Stream in Episode 152 could be foreshadowing their eventual discovery of this split island.

popularity.supportingEvidence: The parallel with Jaya/Skypiea, difficulty in finding Laugh Tale, Roger's journey connections
popularity.counterEvidence: No direct evidence of Laugh Tale being split

sources.title: Skypeia Arc and it's foreshadowing of future events in One Piece

theoryText: The fact that the Knock-Up Stream destroyed Blackbeard's raft in Episode 152, preventing the first major confrontation between Luffy and Blackbeard, is theorized to be significant foreshadowing. Many fans believe this wasn't just convenient timing but represents how fate or destiny plays a role in One Piece. The two characters are destined to clash, but only at the right moment in the story. This parallels how their earlier encounter in Mock Town also didn't result in a fight.

popularity.supportingEvidence: Multiple near-misses between Luffy and Blackbeard, eventual major confrontations later
